title: The novels and tales of Robert Louis Stevenson.
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: He had a pretty full translation of Schiller's ^Esthetic Letters, which we read together, as well as the second part of Faust, in Gladstone Terrace, he helping me with the German. There is no keepsake I should more value than the MS. of that translation.

title: The Letters of Robert Louis Stevenson - Volume 1
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: He had a pretty full translation of Schiller's AESTHETIC LETTERS, which we read together, as well as the second part of FAUST, in Gladstone Terrace, he helping me with the German. There is no keepsake I should more value than the MS. of that translation.

title: The Works of Robert Louis Stevenson - Swanston Edition, Vol. 24
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: We had no religion between the pair of us--that was theflaw. How very different was our last intimacy in Gladstone Terrace. Butyouth must learn--looking back over these wasted opportunities, I musttry rather to remember what I did right, than to bewail the much that Ileft undone and knew not how to do.

title: Tombstoning
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: 'Livingstone Place, just across the Meadows. It's one street along from our own flat, in Gladstone Terrace.'

title: Tombstoning
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: 'How was the party, then, madam?' Nicola asked, taking Amy's hand and turning up Gladstone Terrace towards home.
